Recap: Olivia's hired man traps Ava in the elevator when he receives a phone call from Olivia who tells him the plan is off. He lets Ava go and she promptly goes to the police station to report the man. There, she finds Olivia who is happy to see Ava is okay. Doris, the DA, tells Olivia that she will be charged with murder and her child could go to foster care. Olivia finds the hired man and pays him a deposit, telling him that she may need his services later. Ava's adoptive father leaves a message on Olivia's phone that the name of his ex-wife is, Paralta.

Jonathan and Lizzie move to the penthouse and Tammy and Remy decide to go to supper at the Bauer house. Josh and Reva think about old times when they were younger while they are trapped in the garage. They laugh while remembering and Reva starts the car radio. She dances and invites him to dance with her. As they do so, they stare in one another's eyes and start to kiss, passionately. Cassie finds Billy who tells her that Josh is in the garage. She goes to find Josh.
Transcript: Gillespie: Mrs. Spencer, it's me. About your little problem Ava Peralta, since you didn't mention how loud you wanted me to take it with the young lady, I've got to assume we're talking ten, as in all the way. I just wanted to let you know I'm on it. She won't be bothering you anymore.
Olivia: That was yesterday. Frank! Where is he? Chief Cooper. We have to find him. Frank?
Doris: Would a District Attorney do?
Olivia: I...
Doris: You seem a little upset, Ms. Spencer.
Olivia: I... how do you know my name?

Doris: I know your name because I'm probably going to be prosecuting you for murder. Back in the room, please. Look, we don't allow people of interest to wander the place station without an escort. Did you hear me, Ms. Spencer?
Olivia: I don't want to kill anyone. I just... I didn't mean to... I didn't try to kill anyone.

Doris: Then enter a non- guilty plea. Not that that would help, because from what I've heard-- and this is off the record-- if Ava Peralta testifies against you in court, you're going away for a long, long time.
Olivia: I can't go to jail. My little girl needs me.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Gillespie: This must be my lucky day. Going down?
[SCENE_BREAK]
Lizzie: I hate packing.
Jonathan: Well, your problem is you have too much stuff. See, for me, this-- and little Lou's cage-- will be more than enough.
Lizzie: This stuff is going to get all wrinkly.
Jonathan: No nagging. You're not my real wife, remember?
Lizzie: I know that, but you can't risk getting caught with Tammy. That is why we're leaving.
Jonathan: I am not going to get caught with Tammy. I'm not going to blow it. We're not going to be living above Tammy anymore. Getting out of here is what's best for you and the kid.

Jonathan: Uh-huh.

Tammy: This is a good thing. Jonathan has to do this for the baby and for us. It's not going to be forever.

Harley: Look who it is, my best friend.
Cassie: Hello.

Cassie: Nothing much.
Harley: Do you have time for a cup of coffee?

Harley: Probably just got stuck at work. I wouldn't worry about it.
Cassie: Yeah, probably.
Harley: Cassie. I probably should keep my mouth shut.
Cassie: Oh boy.
Harley: You know? But you're my friend and the thing is that I know first-hand that Josh Lewis is a one-woman guy, and I see you getting your hopes up about this...
Harley: Yeah, that one woman is me, Harley. Josh is free now. He is free to be with a woman of his future, not of his past.

Reva: Yeah, well, that makes two of us. You shouldn't be here with me.

Reva: I just meant that we're divorced and we're here.
Josh: Yeah.
Reva: It's just not fair. I really can't be here. I can't do this.

Reva: They say no good deed goes unpunished.
Josh: Good deed, huh? You mean spying on me?
Reva: I was here looking for Billy.
Josh: Uh-huh. Yeah, that's right. I'm sorry.
Reva: Well, you've accused me of a whole lot worse.
Josh: What do you want?
Reva: Do they have lemonade?
Josh: Yeah.

Josh: Yeah, thank you very much. At least we know we won't starve.
Reva: Or die of thirst.
Josh: What else you got in that bag, huh? Deck of cards, maybe? As I recall, you're a pretty good poker player.
Reva: Yeah, well, I haven't lost my touch, but no cards.
Josh: No cards. So what does that leave us with?
Reva: Well, I guess maybe we could talk like normal people do. It's been a while since we've done that.
Josh: Talk?
Reva: You hesitated.
Josh: No, we can talk. That's fine. We just need to set some ground rules, that's all.
Reva: Ground rules?
Josh: Uh-huh. No regrets. No finger pointing. How's that?
Reva: It's okay.
Josh: And if somebody screws up, they have to pay the other person a dollar.
Reva: You're really into the gambling thing.
Josh: I'll start. Shayne. I got a postcard from Shayne. Seems that while he's saving the world, he still has plenty of time for a young girl named Heather.
Reva: That's funny. When I saw him in New York, it was Isabelle.
Josh: Right. By the way, thank you for not telling me about that because, hey, why would I want to go visit Marah and Shayne in New York?
Reva: You know what? I'm sorry. That was borderline finger-pointing.
Josh: Okay. All right. You know, there was a time when we could pass the time without hardly saying a word.

Jordan Clark, "Inside The Light." My oldest daughter out in L.A., When she came and saw it, she said, "You know, there are a lot of people that really love you." And I said "Well, you know, that's true." And I think that the best thing about it was getting a chance to thank all the fans because without them we don't have a job. I think that's true, right? It was fun. It was so much fun, and it was so much fun because we were a minority in that little theater and we made a big noise. And we won four out of the six awards so that looked pretty good. Kim said, "You look like you're in another place." I think that I was because I don't remember spinning around on stage and my daughter said, "You spun around." That dance. That's tacky. See Billy, Wednesday, September 27, "Inside The Light."
